function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Complex indoor air flows due to temperature differences and heat production exacerbating viral distribution unpredictability","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Unknown presence and location of infectious occupants within indoor spaces","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unintentional supply of outdoor air due to porous building materials or other pathways","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inaccurate measurement of ventilation rates leading to assumption of adequate outdoor air supply","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dependence on co2 data for inferring the risk of airborne infection","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uncertainties in values for quanta generation rate and viral load","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Use of a novel disease with limited data and experience","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uncertainty in quanta generation rate for airborne infection.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inaccurate assessment of infection risk due to low activity levels and inappropriate quanta generation rate.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation rate leading to increased likelihood of airborne infection.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High risk of covid-19 transmission in offices with vocalizing individuals and light exercise.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risk of covid-19 transmission in public indoor spaces with varying ventilation and occupancy scenarios.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Poor ventilation leading to a high number of secondary infections before and after lockdown.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risk of infection in regularly attended indoor spaces due to prolonged exposure to pre/asymptomatic individuals.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Poor ventilation leading to increased s i value, potentially contributing to the spread of covid-19","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uncertainty in transmission and infection nature of covid-19, including potential for new, more transmissible variants","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uncertainty and variability in quanta generation rates impacting infection modeling and risk assessment","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased airborne infection risk due to uncontrolled natural ventilation and high co2 levels in office","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Seasonal variation in airborne infection risk due to changes in outdoor air supply","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Higher secondary infection numbers in classrooms","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increased secondary infection numbers during colder winter months","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Less well ventilated buildings in winter","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Ventilation systems that recirculate a proportion of indoor air can contribute to the spread of contagious diseases if not properly regulated.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Insufficient ventilation in indoor spaces leading to high co2 levels","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Design of school classrooms allowing co2 levels to reach 2000 ppm for brief periods","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased airborne infection risk due to excess co2 and occupancy","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Complex ventilation flows and air flow between spaces","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Variability of covid-19 airborne spread based on environmental conditions and activity level","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Airborne transmission of covid-19 in indoor environments","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limitations of increasing ventilation in winter","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Incomplete understanding of covid-19 transmission mechanisms","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Centralized recirculation systems not effective at filtering out viral material","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited supply of clean air in spaces due to filter effectiveness and flow rate","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential generation of ozone and harmful by-products from uv lamps","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Ineffective air filtration in certain areas of the room due to airflow patterns and room size","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited effectiveness of air cleaners/filters","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Transport of exhaled pathogens to other occupants with personalized ventilation","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Transporting virus-laden droplets with ductless pv system","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased re-suspension of virus-laden particles due to desk or ceiling fans","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Risk of increased rates of deposition of virus-laden particles due to fan usage","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Uncertain deposition rates of covid-19-laden particles in real-world conditions","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential risk of increasing the re-suspension of virus-laden particles within the space due to the use of desk fans","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Ceiling fans inhibiting the vertical mixing and dilution of virus-laden particles within the breathing zone","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Uncertain effectiveness of air ionization technology in eliminating sars-cov-2 and potential production of by-products such as areas where viruses could accumulate.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Upper room ultra-violet germicidal irradiation uvgi may pose a risk if not implemented or maintained systems","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential health risks from prolonged exposure to uv light and generation of harmful
